frontMatter.description: This deprecated pattern guided design for collecting gender identity information from Veterans.
frontMatter.intro: This pattern guided design for collecting gender identity information from Veterans through VA.gov forms and profiles. The current policy recommends against using this pattern.

when_to_use.value: **Avoid redundancy.** Don't ask a user to provide information that VA already has—only collect when VA lacks current data.
**Demonstrate user benefit.** Only request gender identity data when it clearly explains how providing this information will benefit the user in their current task.
**Build trust.** Clarify that data won't influence medical treatment or benefits determinations and enable users to manage preferences in their VA.gov profile.

design_principles.value: **Opt-out option.** Provide an option labeled 'Prefer not to answer'.
**Mark as optional.** Mark questions as optional with clear communication.
**Brief content.** Keep explanatory content brief and integrated into the task flow.
**Stay focused.** Don't divert users from their primary objective.

when_not_to_use.value: **Policy recommendation.** The current policy recommends against using this pattern.
**Paper form limitations.** Many forms are based off of paper forms with limited fields for gender identity—collaborate with stakeholders to expand options.
